content.en: Neurodegenerative biomarker algorithms: Algorithms are being used to improve the diagnosis and prediction of Alzheimer's disease (AD) and other neurodegenerative disorders. These algorithms can identify novel biomarkers in cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) that can distinguish AD from other disorders, as well as combinations of biomarkers that enhance diagnostic accuracy. They can also integrate core CSF biomarkers into new diagnostic algorithms and predict the development of dementia in pre-dementia subjects. Overall, algorithms are helping researchers and clinicians better understand and diagnose AD.
content.da: Neurodegenerative biomarkør-algoritmer: Algoritmer bliver brugt til at forbedre diagnosticering og forudsigelse af Alzheimers sygdom (AD) og andre neurodegenerative lidelser. Disse algoritmer kan identificere nye biomarkører i cerebrospinalvæsken (CSF), som kan skelne AD fra andre lidelser, samt kombinationer af biomarkører, der forbedrer den diagnostiske nøjagtighed. De kan også integrere kerne-CSF-biomarkører i nye diagnostiske algoritmer og forudsige udviklingen af demens hos præ-dementielle personer. Overordnet set hjælper algoritmer forskere og klinikere med bedre at forstå og diagnosticere AD.
